body.p: Assets may be acquired, or liabilities may be incurred, as a result of an event that is not a transaction on market terms. For example:

li.p: the transaction price may be affected by relationships between the parties, or by financial distress or other duress of one of the parties;
an asset may be granted to the entity free of charge by a government or donated to the entity by another party;
a liability may be imposed by legislation or regulation; or
a liability to pay compensation or a penalty may arise from an act of wrongdoing.
